Name.BusinessNameLine1: UNITED WAY OF ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE UNITED WAY IMPROVES LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE UNITED WAY OF ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY'S MISSION IS TO INCREASE THE ORGANIZED CAPACITY OF PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY TO CARE FOR ONE ANOTHER.
IRS990.Description: UNITED WAY OF ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY FOCUSES ON THE BUILDING BLOCKS FOR A GOOD LIFE--EDUCATION, INCOME AND HEALTH. OUR ROLE IN THE COMMUNITY HAS CHANGED OVER THE PAST SEVERAL YEARS. FUNDRAISING IS ONLY PART OF WHAT THE ORGANIZATION DOES TO CHANGE LIVES. UNITED WAY ASSESSES THE COMMUNITY TO CREATE THE GREASTEST IMPACT POSSIBLE TO CREATE LASTING SOLUTIONS FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. WE HAVE FIVE AREAS OF FOCUS THAT INCLUDE MEETING BASIC NEEDS, LIFE LONG LEARNING, A DYNAMIC COMMUNITY, THRIVING FAMILIES AND SUCCESSFUL CHILDREN AND PERSONAL AND COMMUNITY SAFETY.UNITED WAY PARTICIPATES IN SEVERAL PROGRAMS TO BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY INCLUDING 2-1-1, A SERVICE THAT CONNECTS PEOPLE TO RESOURCES WHEN THEY NEED HELP. OUR ORGANIZATION ALSO FACILITATES THE EMERGENCY FOOD & SHELTER PROGRAM, WHICH SUPPORTS AGENCIES WITH FOOD, SHELTER AND UTILITY ASSISTANCE. THE AGENCY PROMOTES VOLUNTEERISM AND ADVOCACY THROUGH VOLUNTEERMAINE, WHERE INDIVIDUALS CAN ACCESS VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES, AND A DAY OF CARING EVENT, WHICH MOBILIZES VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL NON-PROFIT AGENCIES. UNITED WAY OF ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY WORKS WITH AREA PARTNERS TO COODINATE AN EARNED INCOME TAX CREDIT (EITC) PROGRAM WHICH IS A FEDERAL TAX BENEFIT FOR PEOPLE WHO WORK AND HELPS PEOPLE WITH LOW-TO MODERATE INCOMES WITH TAX PREPARATION.SEVERAL NEW INITIATIVES THAT THE ORGANIZATION IS WORKING ON INCLUDE A 10 YEAR PLAN TO END HOMELESSNESS, A PANTRY PROJECT WHERE EMPLOYEES COLLECT FOOD DONATIONS TO CONTRIBUTE TO LOCAL PANTRIES, AND FAMILYWIZE, A COMMUNITY SERVICE PARTNERSHIP THAT DISTRIBUTES FREE PRESCRIPTION DISCOUNT CARDS THAT CAN SAVE ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS UP TO 30% ON MEDICATION.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE EARNINGS ON THE PERMANENT ENDOWNMENT ARE TO BE USED TO FURTHER THE UNITED WAY'S PROGRAMS AND MISSION. INVESTMENT EARNINGS ON THE ENDOWNMENT ARE MAILED TO THE AGENCY EVERY YEAR BY BANK TRUSTEE OF THE ENDOWNMENT WITH THE CORPUS REMAINING UNTOUCHED. THE BOARD HAS DESIGNATED NET ASSETS TO ESTABLISH A BOARD DESIGNATED ENDOWMENT TO PROTECT PARTICIPATING AGENCIES FROM ANY FUTURE SHORTFALLS IN CAMPAIGN, FLUCTUATION IN THE UNCOLLECTIBLE RATES, NATURAL DISASTERS OR OTHER GOVERNMENT DECLARED DISASTERS, OR OTHER OCCURENCES DEEMED AN EMERGENCY BY THE BOARD.
DONOR DESIGNATED CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER AGENCIES OFFSET AGAINST REVENUE 208802.
DONOR DESIGNATED CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHERS INCLUDED AS EXPENSES ON FORM 990 208802.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: SISTERS OF CHARITY HEALTH SYSTEM-FOOD PANTRY

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: FOOD FOR THE HOMELESS AND LOW INCOME
DESIGNATIONS TO 75 NON PROFIT AGENCIES FOR COMMUNITY PROGRAMS
YOUTH PROGRAMS FOR AT RISK TEENS

ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING "DISCRETIONARY" FUNDING FROM THE UNITED WAY(IE. COMMUNITY CARE/IMPACT/INVESTMENT UNDERGO INTENSIVE PRE-SCREENING BEFORE BEING AWARDED FUNDING. SUCH SCREENING INCLUDES: AN APPLICATION PROCESS THAT INCLUDES EXPLANATION OF PROPOSED USE & RESULTS OF FUNDING. FINANCIAL REVIEW OF THE ORGANIZATION TO GAIN A LEVEL OF ASSURANCE THAT THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS SOUND FISCAL POLICIES, VERIFICATION OF COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE PATRIOT ACT, VERIFICATION OF CURRENT STATUS AS AN IRS CODE SECTION 501(C) (3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION. ORGANIZATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE UNITED WAY WITH A FINAL REPORT AT THE END OF THE FUNDING PERIOD THAT VERIFIES THAT ALL FUNDING HAS BEEN USED FOR THE PURPOSES INTENDED AND WHAT THE RESULTS WERE COMPARED TO THE PROPOSED RESULTS FROM THE ORIGINAL APPLICATION.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: PROCESS FOR AWARDING DONOR DESIGNATIONS (AGENCY DESIGNATIONS)

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING DONOR DESIGNATED CONTRIBUTIONS THRU UNITED WAY UNDERGO SCREENING PRIOR TO THE DISTRIBUTION OF FUNDING. UNITED WAY WILL VERIFY COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE PATRIOT ACT, AND CURRENT STATUS AS AN IRS CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: ANDROSCOGGIN HEAD START AND CHILD CARE

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: SPILLERS INC IS ONE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S SUPPLIER OF OFFICE PRODUCTS AND SUPPLIES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 10b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: UNITED WAY OF ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY IS AFFILIATED WITH UNITED WAY WORLDWIDE. UNITED WAY WORLDWIDE HAS MEMBERSHIP STANDARDS THAT ARE USED BY ALL UNITED WAYS AFFILIATED WITH THE INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGES AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM TO CONDUCT A YEAR END AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE AUDITORS REVIEW THE PRELIMINARY AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AT A FINANCE COMMITTEE MEETING. UPON APPROVAL FROM THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, THE UNITED WAY OF ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY TREASURER AND FINANCE DIRECTOR PRESENT THE AUDIT TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE 990 IS FORWARDED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND STAFF ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A SIGNED CODE OF ETHICS STATEMENT THAT INCLUDES CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW ALL SUBMISSIONS AND FOLLOW UP ON ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICTS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AN INDEPENDENT BODY CONSISTING OF THE BOARD CHAIR, VICE-CHAIR OF THE BOARD AND CHAIR OF THE HUMAN RESOURCE COMMITTEE ANNUALLY CONDUCTS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S PERFORMANCE REVIEW ALIGNED WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S STRATEGIC DIRECTION AND MEASURES OF SUCCESS. MARKET COMPARABILITY DATA IS COLLECTED FROM UNITED WAY OF AMERICA AND MAINE ASSOCIATION OF NON-PROFITS. MARKET COMPARABILITY DATA INCLUDES COMPENSATION RANGES AND SUPPLEMENTAL BENEFITS ESTABLISHED FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THIS INFORMATION IS REVIEWED BY THE INDEPENDENT BODY PRIOR TO MAKING RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING PAY AND BENEFITS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON ITS OWN WEBSITE AS WELL AS ON GUIDESTAR'S WEBSITE.REQUESTS THAT ARE RECEIVED FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S DOCUMENTS OR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ANSWERED WITHIN ONE WEEK OF RECEIVING THE REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Changes in Net Assets or Fund Balances:
